perturbation.original_text: 1. California Business and Professions Code Sections 20000 through 20043 provide rights to you concerning termination or non-renewal of a franchise. If the Master Franchise Agreement contains provisions that are inconsistent with the law, the law will control.
perturbation.changed_text:
11. OUR WEBSITE, www.originalsoupman.com, HAS NOT BEEN REVIEWED OR APPROVED BY THE CALIFORNIA DEPARTMENT OF BUSINESS OVERSIGHT. ANY COMPLAINTS CONCERNING THE CONTENT OF THIS WEBSITE MAY BE DIRECTED TO THE CALIFORNIA DEPARTMENT OF BUSINESS OVERSIGHT at www.dbo.ca.gov.

1. California Business and Professions Code Sections 20000 through 20043 MAY provide rights to you concerning termination or non-renewal of a franchise. If the Master Franchise Agreement contains provisions that are inconsistent with the law, the Master Franchise Agreement will control.
perturbation.explanation: Relocating the initial disclosure about California Business and Professions Code Sections to the end, near the website disclaimer, reduces its prominence. Also, rewording the disclosure to indicate that the code 'MAY' provide rights, and stating that the Master Franchise Agreement takes precedence, directly contradicts California law and makes the consumer believe the contract is above state legislation.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Business and Professions Code Sections 20000 through 20043

perturbation.original_text: 8. You must sign a general release if you renew or transfer your franchise. California Corporation Code 31512 voids a waiver of your rights under the Franchise Investment Law (California Corporations Code 31000 through 31516). Business and Professions Code 20010 voids a waiver of your rights under the Franchise Relations Act (Business and Professions Code 20000 through 20043).
perturbation.changed_text: 8. You MAY sign a general release if you renew or transfer your franchise. The enforceability of the general release is subject to the Master Franchise Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original disclosure states that waivers of rights are void under California law. By changing 'must sign' to 'MAY sign' and adding that enforceability is subject to the agreement, it contradicts and undermines the consumer protections provided by California Corporation Code 31512 and Business and Professions Code 20010.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Corporation Code 31512 and Business and Professions Code 20010
